correction_response: This tweet is potentially misleading. While it's true that Elon Musk is a public figure and his movements could be tracked, it's important to note that Twitter accounts do not have the capability to physically follow or pose a direct personal safety risk. The tweet seems to conflate online tracking with physical stalking.
note_1_text: The implied account in this tweet is elonjet, which is currently banned:     https://twitter.com/elonjet    Elonjet used to use publicly available plane tracking data to follow which airports Musk’s private jet flew to.
note_2_text: The implied account in this tweet is ElonJet, which is currently banned:     https://twitter.com/elonjet    The ban comes after a vehicle carrying Musk's son, X, was attacked. Musk implied that Sweeney (the owner of the bot account) was somehow involved:    https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1603190155107794944
queries:
1. Laws regarding stalking and harassment on social media platforms
2. Legal implications of tracking someone's plane
3. How does Twitter handle threats to personal safety
tweet_category: Human Rights, Social Issues, and Activism
tweet_text: My commitment to free speech extends even to not banning the account following my plane, even though that is a direct personal safety risk
